change.changenote: Regulation BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 307/2021, effective November 29, 2021.

bcl:definition.bcl:text: applicant means an applicant to the court for enrolment as a member of the society;
board of examiners means the board of examiners appointed under section 10 of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of sections 6 and 7 of the Act, an applicant being examined must complete a written paper in each of the following subject areas:
An applicant must complete each paper described in subsection (1) in no more than 2 hours.
To pass an examination, an applicant must obtain

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: at least 65% of the total marks allowed for all 6 papers and at least 55% of the marks allowed for each separate paper, or
at least 55% of the marks allowed for each supplemental paper written under subsection (4).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If an applicant obtains 65% of the total marks allowed for all 6 papers written under subsection (1), but fails in 3 or fewer of the papers to obtain at least 55% of the marks allowed for the paper or each of the papers, as applicable, the applicant may write a supplemental examination in the subject or subjects in which the applicant failed.

For the purpose of being examined in notarial procedure (statutes), an applicant must have knowledge of those provisions of the provincial and federal statutes and regulations that apply to the work and duties of a notary public.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: has the control and conduct of the examination of applicants,
having consideration for the convenience of applicants, must appoint the time and place of examinations, and
must mark the examinations and report the results to the secretary of the society.

bcl:section.bcl:text: An applicant must pay to the board of examiners a fee of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: $525 for the examination for enrolment, and
$150 for each paper written in a supplemental examination under section 2 (4).

bcl:section.bcl:text: An applicant must pay to the registrar a fee of

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: $100 to apply to the court for enrolment as a member,
$100 on the enrolment of an applicant as a member, and
$100 for the issuance of a commission under section 13 (4) of the Act.

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: For the purpose of section 11 of the Act, an applicant must take an oath of office in the form set out in Form 1 of the Schedule.
For the purpose of section 13 (4) of the Act, the registrar must issue a commission under that section in the form set out in Form 2 of the Schedule.
